Review
Mobile UI Updates
1. Chat History Restore

The mobile chat history was failing to load because the IDE sidebar list was empty. We discovered that the Active Chat was present in a different context (Webview/Editor). We updated 
cdp_bridge.mjs
 to detect messages in the active editor even if the sidebar history list is empty.

Fix:

Updated CSS selector in 
cdp_bridge.mjs
 to target .flex.flex-row.items-center.justify-between (Chat items).
getHistory()
 now returns the active chat thread ("Walkthrough" or current session).
2. Real File Uploads

We implemented full file upload support from the mobile interface to the IDE.

Components:

Server (
server.mjs
): Added /api/upload endpoint using multer to handle multipart uploads.
Bridge (
cdp_bridge.mjs
): Added 
uploadFile(path)
 method which uses DOM.setFileInputFiles to programmatically attach files to the IDE's hidden file input.
Frontend (
mobile.html
): Added a ðŸ“Ž Attach button to the Control Panel.

Usage:

Click "ðŸ“Ž Attach" on mobile.
Select a file (Image or other).
The file is uploaded to the server and strictly attached to the IDE chat context.
3. Verification
Verified /api/history returns valid items.
Verified /api/upload via curl successfully attaches files to the active chat context.

Mobile UI Updates
1. Chat History Restore

The mobile chat history was failing to load because the IDE sidebar list was empty. We discovered that the Active Chat was present in a different context (Webview/Editor). We updated 
cdp_bridge.mjs
 to detect messages in the active editor even if the sidebar history list is empty.

Fix:

Updated CSS selector in 
cdp_bridge.mjs
 to target .flex.flex-row.items-center.justify-between (Chat items).
getHistory()
 now returns the active chat thread ("Walkthrough" or current session).
2. Real File Uploads

We implemented full file upload support from the mobile interface to the IDE.

Components:

Server (
server.mjs
): Added /api/upload endpoint using multer to handle multipart uploads.
Bridge (
cdp_bridge.mjs
): Added 
uploadFile(path)
 method which uses DOM.setFileInputFiles to programmatically attach files to the IDE's hidden file input.
Frontend (
mobile.html
): Added a ðŸ“Ž Attach button to the Control Panel.

Usage:

Click "ðŸ“Ž Attach" on mobile.
Select a file (Image or other).
The file is uploaded to the server and strictly attached to the IDE chat context.
3. Verification
Verified /api/history returns valid items.
Verified /api/upload via curl successfully attaches files to the active chat context.
